results.title: Governor Pledges to Fix Water Crisis in Michigan
results.abstract: Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan was uncharacteristically contrite and emphatic. “I’m sorry most of all that I let you down,” he said, citing repeated missteps in failing to identify lead in the drinking water.
results.byline: By JULIE BOSMAN and MITCH SMITH

multimedia.caption: Specialist Eric Perrigan of the Michigan National Guard loaded a case of canned water for a Flint resident on Friday.

results.title: C.D.C. Urges Zika Testing for Some Who Are Pregnant
results.abstract: The guidelines, though seen as imperfect, offer a way to proceed with worried patients who have recently lived in or traveled to an area where the mosquito-borne virus is being transmitted.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

multimedia.caption: A researcher at São Paulo University in Brazil holds a container of Aedes aegypti mosquitoes, which can spread the Zika virus. On Tuesday, the C.D.C. issued guidelines for pregnant women who have visited countries where the virus is spreading.
multimedia.copyright: Andre Penner/Associated Press

results.title: ISIS Magazine Confirms ‘Jihadi John’ Was Killed
results.abstract: The most recent issue of the militant group’s online publication, Dabiq, included a eulogy for Mohammed Emwazi, a British citizen.
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

results.title: Prominent Doctor at Mt. Sinai Charged With Sexual Abuse
results.abstract: An emergency room doctor at Mount Sinai Hospital on the Upper East Side was arrested and accused of drugging, groping and masturbating on a female patient and groping another.

multimedia.caption: Dr. David H. Newman, who was arrested on Tuesday and accused of groping two patients at Mount Sinai Hospital in separate episodes several months apart.

results.title: Palin Endorses Trump in Iowa Speech
results.abstract: With the caucuses less than two weeks away, Sarah Palin, the 2008 vice-presidential nominee, could help Donald Trump with evangelicals and the Tea Party.
results.byline: By ALAN RAPPEPORT and MAGGIE HABERMAN

multimedia.caption: Donald J. Trump and Sarah Palin at a campaign event in Ames, Iowa, on Tuesday.

results.title: Clinton Email Said to Have Material Above ‘Top Secret’
results.abstract: A letter by the intelligence agencies’ inspector general says that a review of emails on former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton’s private computer server found information that would place it among the government’s most closely guarded secrets.

results.title: Ta-Nehisi Coates Criticizes Sanders on Reparations
results.abstract: Ta-Nehisi Coates, a National Book Award winner who often writes on racism, said Senator Bernie Sanders’s argument that reparations could not make it through Congress could also be said about much of his platform.

results.title: A Deadly Deployment, a Navy SEAL’s Despair
results.abstract: Fellow officers saw the death of Cmdr. Job W. Price, which was ruled a suicide, as a cautionary tale of how men were ground down by years of fighting and losing comrades.
results.byline: By NICHOLAS KULISH and CHRISTOPHER DREW
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

results.title: Sanctions (and Sabotage) Helped Pressure Iran
results.abstract: A U.S. covert sabotage program that began in the Clinton administration and escalated over the next 15 years played a critical role in persuading the Iranians to agree to a deal.

multimedia.caption: On Sunday, President Obama announced that Iran had freed five Iranian-American nationals, and that the United States and European nations had lifted oil and financial sanctions on Iran.

results.title: Prisoner Swap Doesn’t Mean Iran Gets Anyone
results.abstract: Six of the seven freed by the United States are naturalized or native-born Americans with dual citizenship. Most, if not all, have no immediate plans to move to Iran.
results.byline: By KAREN ZRAICK and RICK GLADSTONE

results.title: Ayatollah Warns Against U.S. ‘Deceptions’
results.abstract: In a letter to Iran’s president, the supreme leader cautiously welcomed the completion of the nuclear deal and end to economic sanctions but said the United States breaks its promises.

multimedia.caption: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran’s supreme leader, in Tehran in January. Throughout the prolonged negotiations over the nuclear agreement, he played both sides of the divide between reformers and hard-liners.
multimedia.copyright: Office of Iranian Supreme Leader, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.abstract: Well into winter, meteorologists predicted that the season’s first significant storm would head up the coast on Friday into Saturday.

results.title: Airdrops Called Too Risky to Help Starving Syrians
results.abstract: American officials said that the Syrian government’s antiaircraft weapons posed a threat and that dropping aid to a populated area could hurt the very people it was meant to help.
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

results.title: High Court to Hear Case on Obama’s Immigration Actions
results.abstract: A coalition of 26 states has accused the president of abuse of power over his efforts to spare millions of immigrants from deportation and provide them with work permits.

results.title: De Blasio’s Plan on Carriages Keeps Gaining Critics
results.abstract: A day after Bill de Blasio declared the matter closed, his proposal to limit the hansoms to Central Park drew more criticism, with pedicab drivers chanting “one-term mayor” outside City Hall.
results.byline: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and J. DAVID GOODMAN

multimedia.caption: A horse-drawn carriage waits for a fare on Central Park South Avenue this month. A plan by Mayor Bill de Blasio to reduce the number of carriages and restrict them to Central Park has attracted a diverse group of opponents.
multimedia.copyright: Bryan Thomas for The New York Times

results.title: Are America’s Best Days Past or Ahead?
results.abstract: A new book argues that the great strides in American innovation and prosperity made from 1920 through 1970 are unlikely to be repeated.
des_facet: The Rise and Fall of American Growth (Book)
